Articles.Content:
![mxzw0IU.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mxzw0IU.jpg)

Mind=BLOWN!

(Also the other stuff because it turns out it's all one image not several ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-19T00:49:14Z" title="02/19/2015 12:49  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 19, 2015</time> by GregroxMun**
My heart sank. Turns out it is a typo and it's Min*i*mus.
I'm so going to name a ship the "Interrobang", so much better than just calling it .... (might also call one Dysania, because reasons).

> 
> Who doesn't know tines?!?!

Yeah, that surprised me too.

"The wiggly black lines on the paper are 'letters' and they form 'words'!" heh.

> 
> My heart sank. Turns out it is a typo and it's Min*i*mus.

Nice... do you have any other dyslexic tendencies? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I already knew an infinity symbol is called a lemniscate, but I certainly never refer to it as that...

As for the rest, I had no clue.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-18T22:00:24Z" title="02/18/2015 10:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 18, 2015</time> by Rthsom**

I'm going to keep calling it Minimus in my head, though. I already have a whole story written about a mission there. Now I have to go back and correct all the occurrences that I accidentally misspelled. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

I blame it on the fact that I already knew that about the pinky toe, so my brain interpolated an "i" into the name of the moon where there isn't one.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-18T22:08:08Z" title="02/18/2015 10:08  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 18, 2015</time> by JAD\_Interplanetary**
I'm pretty sure the cup thing already had a name, it's a sleeve ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Petrichor is glorious. Now I can preach the glory of Petrichor!

> 
> Petrichor is glorious. Now I can preach the glory of Petrichor!

All hail Petrichor!

That article/image launched a disinformation that the smallest toe is called Minmus. It's called minimus (Latin: "the smallest one").

And some of those things aren't really obscure...

Ah, yes, "petrichor."

The things you learn from Doctor Who... at least, I have a strong recollection of it in the House episode.
